title: Fear of terrorists has almost ended in Kashmir: L-G Manoj Sinha
content: Reflecting on the improvement in the situation in the Kashmir Valley, Manoj Sinha said Lal Chowk, which used to be gloomy after sunset, now remains alive till late evenings.

title: Huntington’s Disease Society of India calls for urgent government action for inclusion under National Rare Diseases Policy
content: The first meeting of the task force, which has been formed to discuss the action plan for HD, dementia and other neurodegenerative disorders, will be held on August 25

title: Census 2027 to retain 2011 Census definition of an urban area
content: An urban unit or a ‘census town’ is defined as ‘all other villages’ with a minimum population of 5,000 people with a density of population of 400 persons per sq. km. and where 75% of the male working population is engaged in non-agricultural pursuits

title: A.P. sand artist to depict story of Lord Ganesh through 15 sculptures
content: Balaji Varaprasad and his team of six members are using 35 tonnes of river sand to make the sculptures which will be placed in a pandal Sitara Centre in Vijayawada

title: Manipulated charity videos blur the line between fake and genuine cases
content: Law enforcement agencies remain largely unaware of a significant number of these crimes. Inter-State lobby suspected to be behind fake videos

title: Chief Minister announces ₹1 crore life insurance cover for municipal workers
content: Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu announces insurance coverage for municipal workers in event of death or disability

title: Seven persons under treatment for amoebic meningoencephalitis in Kerala
content: Studies planned on other types of amoeba; Naegleria fowleri,  or ‘brain-eating amoeba’ found to have been causing infections in State since 2016

title: India-Bangladesh Land Boundary Agreement 2015 | 10 years of Indian citizenship
content: The historic Land Boundary Agreement in 2015, which led to the swap of enclaves between India and Bangladesh, granted citizenship to about 15,000 people who had felt stateless for almost seven decades. They speak about hopes and aspirations that have been realised and the challenges that persist

title: Five-year-old tribal boy dies of fever in Koodalarkudy in Idukki
content: Since Koodalarkudy tribal settlement had no road connectivity, the family was forced to carry the child on a makeshift stretcher made of clothes through the forest for about 10 km

title: Trump names close aide Sergio Gor as Ambassador to India, sparking hopes of better India-U.S. ties, concern over regional role
content: White House Personnel chief also named as Special Envoy on South and Central Asian Affairs; foreign policy experts worry this may indicate continued U.S. interest in mediating between India and Pakistan

title: Indigenous clocks delay ISRO’s plans to replace defunct Navic satellites
content: An official says while the rubidium clocks are based on an indigenous design, there are key components that needs to be imported and this is contributing to procurement challenges and delays in commissioning

title: Present-day politics is about showmanship and publicity, Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge says, urges professionals to join
content: The first batch of the Dr. Manmohan Singh Fellows Program by the All India Professionals’ Congress inducted 50 mid-career professionals, intellectuals, academics, and civil society activists into the party

title: Early Onam gift for Messi fans
content: Sports Minister V. Abdurahiman confirms that Argentine football legend Lionel Messi will come to the State with his World Cup-winning team in November

title: Nicobar island mega project being ‘bulldozed’, ‘fresh evidence’ of administration making false claims, says Jairam Ramesh
content: The Hindu reported on Saturday that the Tribal Council in Nicobar islands has written a fresh letter to the Tribal Affairs Minister Jual Oram about the island administration’s claims of settling the forest rights of tribespeople

title: BBMP cancels appointment of 72 guest faculty in its schools and colleges
content: In addition, the appointment of 37 faculty members who were working in BBMP schools and colleges that have achieved a result of less than 50% in class 10 and II PUC exams consistently over the past three years has been cancelled

title: Congress party to give 42% seats to BCs in local body polls, and take Vote Theft campaign to villages
content: TPCC chief Mahesh Kumar Goud alleged that massive ‘vote theft’ had taken place across the country, enabling the BJP to secure a third consecutive term

title: Emphasis on indigenisation in manufacturing of defence-related products in Rajasthan
content: The State government’s proposed defence aerospace policy was a key feature discussed at the meeting. Defence production licences in the private sector have increased from 246 to 742 in the last decade,” senior Defence official says

title: SMA conference inaugurated in Thiruvananthapuram
content: Stakeholders urged to evolve sustainable financing mechanisms so that equity in care and access and justice can be offered.

title: Low-pressure area to trigger heavy rain in Kerala next week
content: Central and north Kerala likely to witness heavy rain for three to four days, triggered by the low-pressure system

title: NHAI to appoint new consultancy to fast-track NH 183 expansion
content: Move comes after the earlier agency, appointed in 2016, failed to complete the assigned work within the stipulated timeframe. The new consultancy will be given a definite timeline to complete the project, ensuring no indefinite delays, says Kottayam MP

title: Applications invited for theatre festival
content: ‘Voices in the Silence’ will be the theme of ITFoK that will be staged from January 25 to February 1

title: Commerce Minister urges traders to sell Made-in-India goods, reject foreign goods
content: Opposition parties in Bihar are against SIR because they want migrant workers, enrolled as voters in other States, to vote a second time in Assembly polls

title: Cochin, Kannur airports top in passenger experience
content: Thiruvananthapuram, a PPP-run airport, and  Calicut International Airport, Karipur, an AAI-run airport, both with score of 4,82  need to do more

title: Expert panel reviews NH traffic bottlenecks in Thrissur, directs NHAI to speed up work
content: Panel, formed after High Court directive, expresses dissatisfaction with the slow  progress of the construction, suggests corrective measures

title: Uproar in U.P. as man carries dead newborn in bag to DM’s office; Opposition alleges healthcare collapse
content: The man says the private hospital kept demanding more money even as his wife’s pain increased and the newborn died due to the delay in delivery. Lakhimpur Kheri district administration seals hospital

title: Tarring begins on NH 544 alternative road at Muringoor after protests and court orders
content: From Friday night, traffic towards Ernakulam was diverted through Aloor after blocking vehicles at Kodakara. Alternative route being prepared since construction of seven underpasses has resulted in severe traffic blocks on the NH

title: Body of woman found in waste pit in Kothamangalam identified
content: ‘The victim has been identified as Santha, 61, of Kunnathuthazham, who had been missing from Vengoor near Perumbavoor since August 17’

title: TVK’s conference lacked vision and clarity about ideology: Thirumavalavan
content: Speaking to reporters in Chennai, the VCK president says TVK president Vijay’s speech did not have any constructive opinions or an action plan

title: Swarna Andhra–Swachh Andhra drive focuses on ‘Monsoon Hygiene’
content: Collectors in Anantapur, Nandyal, and Kurnool lead rallies, cleanliness drives, and awareness campaigns to promote safe and hygienic practices among the public

title: Did D.K. Shivakumar send a subtle message to Cong. high command by singing RSS anthem?
content: Though he declared himself a ‘born Congressman’ the very next day, his gesture in the Assembly has left many guessing

title: Chief Minister calls for exploring Willingdon Island’s potential as a global tourism hub
content: Cochin Port Authority urged to take the initiative to examine development possibilities and formulate appropriate projects, as the island, created in 1928, gears up for its centenary celebrations

title: Home Department rejected my letter recommending parole for life convict Srikanth, says Nellore Rural MLA Kotamreddy Sridhar Reddy
content: Vowing not to give such letters in the future, the Nellore Rural legislator accuses YSRCP leaders of spreading false information on the issue

title: CBI facilitates return of extortion case fugitive from Azerbaijan
content: An extradition request was sent to the Azerbaijan authorities on January 7, 2025, after CBI got an Interpol Red Notice in 2024

title: Trump tariffs: India should explore the option of ‘decoupling’ from the U.S. and diversifying its export destinations, says Biswajit Dhar
content: Trade policy expert suggests India diversify its exports and engage with developing countries amid U.S. tariff policies.

title: Aviation summit highlights potential of air taxis for Kerala’s urban mobility
content: Panel discussion on the first day of a two-day summit in Kochi explores the potential of air taxis, including helicopters, seaplanes, and eVTOLs for urban mobility

title: Dharmasthala whistleblower arrested: From confessions to custody - and mystery of temple town 'mass murders'
content: The Dharmasthala mass burial case in Karnataka has taken a surprising turn with the arrest of the key complainant, Chinnaiah, due to inconsistencies found in his statements and submitted documents. This development follows the retraction of claims by a woman who alleged her daughter's disappearance in Dharmasthala, adding further complexity to the ongoing investigation into alleged murders, rapes, and burials.

title: Trump names new ambassador: Can Sergio Gor re-open the door between US and India?
content: Sergio Gor, a figure with limited prior India expertise but deep ties to President Trump, has been appointed as the US ambassador to New Delhi. While some welcome his direct access to the President as beneficial for US-India relations, others express concern over his lack of experience and the broader trend of prioritizing loyalty over expertise in Trump's ambassadorial appointments.

title: 'India chose not to ...': PM Modi on how country 'missed the bus' - what he said
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi asserted that India has seized opportunities since 2014, contrasting it with previous governments he claimed were entangled in vote-bank politics and missed crucial technology and industry advancements. Speaking at the ET World Leaders Forum, Modi highlighted past failures in capitalizing on the internet and 2G eras, leading to dependence on foreign players.

title: India clears Indo-German Rs 70k crore submarine deal: 6 advanced subs to boost Navy fleet
content: The Centre has approved negotiations for building six advanced submarines in India with German collaboration under Project 75 India. Mazagaon Dockyards Limited and ThyssenKrupp Marine Systems are expected to start negotiations by the end of this month. The submarines will feature Air Independent Propulsion systems, enhancing the Indian Navy's operational readiness in the Indian Ocean region.

title: OpenAI CEO: Fatherhood 'rewired' me; colleagues say Altman's kid will help humanity
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman shared that becoming a father to a baby boy via surrogacy has profoundly impacted him, altering his priorities and potentially improving his decision-making for the future of AI. Colleagues believe parenthood will positively influence his choices. Altman described experiencing immediate neurochemical changes upon his son's birth, coinciding with OpenAI's ambitious expansion plans, including the Stargate initiative.

title: Asia Cup: 'Don't cross the line'; Wasim Akram warns players, fans ahead of IND vs PAK
content: Pakistani legend Wasim Akram has urged both Indian and Pakistani players and fans to maintain discipline during their Asia Cup clashes. Akram acknowledged India's strong form, highlighting that the team which handles pressure best will emerge victorious. He also expressed his desire for the resumption of India-Pakistan Test series, emphasizing the global appeal and historic significance of such encounters.

title: By year-end, first Made in India chip will be out in the market, says PM Modi - top quotes
content: Prime Minister Modi, speaking at the ET World Leaders Forum 2025, asserted India's pivotal role in the global economy, projecting a 20% contribution in the coming years, underpinned by macroeconomic stability. He highlighted strengthened banking systems, low inflation, and controlled deficits as signs of resilience. The forum also featured discussions on AI, global relations, and India's growing defense industry.

title: UP: Dalit Superintending Engineer assaulted in Ballia; FIR filed against local neta
content: In Ballia, Uttar Pradesh, a Dalit Superintending Engineer Lal Singh was allegedly attacked in his office. The assault was led by Munna Bahadur Singh and involved caste-based slurs and physical violence. An FIR has been filed, and the Uttar Pradesh Rajya Vidyut Parishad Abhiyanta Sangh condemned the incident. They are demanding an Engineer Protection Act.

title: Technology that Larry Ellison once called "gibberish" has made him 2nd richest man
content: Larry Ellison, once a cloud computing skeptic, has become the second-richest person globally as Oracle's cloud services boom. Fueled by AI demand, Oracle's cloud infrastructure is experiencing record growth, attracting major clients like OpenAI. With significant investments in data centers, Oracle anticipates substantial revenue growth in the coming years.

title: 'India will soon have its own space station': PM Modi sets big space ambition
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced India's ambitious plan to establish its own space station, highlighting the nation's rapid advancements in space technology, including successful space docking capabilities. With over 60 space missions completed in the last 11 years and the upcoming Gaganyaan mission, India aims for a quantum jump in the space sector.

title: ‘Overlooking each other's history’: Jaishankar takes swipe at US, Pakistan
content: External affairs minister Dr S Jaishankar on Saturday criticised US–Pakistan for “overlooking each other's history,” recalling the Abbottabad raid that killed Osama bin Laden. He again rejected claims of US mediation in the post-Operation Sindoor ceasefire, stressing it was a direct India–Pakistan deal, and warned opposition against compromising farmers’ interests or India’s strategic autonomy.

title: 'Funny that pro-business…': India to US on buying Russian crude oil amid Trump's tariffs
content: Amidst trade tensions with the US, India asserts its right to prioritize national interests in trade deals and oil procurement from Russia. Ministers Jaishankar and Goyal emphasized that trade decisions are guided by national priorities, not geopolitical pressures. Despite tariff challenges, Indian businesses remain confident, and the government is exploring strategies to enhance international trade relationships.

title: SpaceX exit: Elon Musk on 14-year-old prodigy Kairan Quazi’s resignation
content: Elon Musk claims ignorance of Kairan Quazi's SpaceX tenure following the 16-year-old's resignation. Quazi, who joined SpaceX at 14, is transitioning to Citadel Securities, citing a desire for faster-paced challenges. He previously criticized LinkedIn for age-based restrictions, highlighting biases in opportunity access.

title: 'Don’t change it': Ashwin warns Gambhir & Co over fitness overhaul
content: Ravichandran Ashwin has cautioned Gautam Gambhir's new support staff against abrupt changes to the Indian team's fitness regimes. He highlighted potential harm to players due to frequent alterations in training methods and testing parameters, referencing his own past struggles.

title: US reviewing 55 mn visa holders: New risks Indian students can’t afford to ignore
content: The Trump administration is reviewing all 55 million valid US visa holders for potential legal or security violations, with over 6,000 student visas already revoked. Indian students are facing intensified scrutiny, including social media checks, digital device reviews, and background vetting using law enforcement databases. Even minor or dismissed charges may now impact visa status. Universities have adjusted policies to remain compliant, while students are urged to exercise caution online and ensure strict adherence to immigration rules.

title: 'We love and miss you'- Vanessa Bryant pens emotional tribute to late husband
content: Kobe Bryant's legacy was honored on what would have been his 47th birthday, with heartfelt tributes from his widow, Vanessa, and the Los Angeles Lakers. Bryant, who tragically passed away in 2020, remains a legendary figure. A film project, 'With the 8th Pick,' is in development, chronicling his journey to the Lakers during the 1996 NBA draft.

title: Judge seals filing after Janel Grant medical records leak
content: A legal battle involving Janel Grant, Dr. Carlon Colker, and WWE took a turn when sensitive medical records were briefly exposed online. This occurred during Colker's defamation lawsuit against Grant's attorney, adding complexity to Grant's ongoing abuse and trafficking case against Vince McMahon and WWE. The court has since ordered the document sealed to protect Grant's privacy.

title: Meghan Markle ‘furious’ as Swift–Kelce overshadow her show launch
content: Meghan Markle's attempt to regain spotlight faces challenges. Her Netflix series announcement coincides with Taylor Swift's surprise album release. Reports suggest Markle feels overshadowed by Swift's media attention. The response to Markle's trailer is lukewarm. Swift's dominance continues with Super Bowl speculation. The incident highlights the difficulty in competing with Swift's cultural influence.

title: Sidney Crosby to Bedard: ‘They probably don’t need me’
content: Sidney Crosby, a celebrated leader in Canadian hockey, is preparing for the 2026 Winter Olympics, aiming for another gold while mentoring the next generation, including Connor Bedard. Crosby's influence extends beyond scoring, shaping young players through patience, composure, and leadership. His mentorship ensures Canada's continued success in developing champions for years to come.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo devastated after final loss; Al-Nassr lose on penalties
content: Al-Nassr faced defeat against Al-Ahli in the Saudi Super Cup final after a penalty shootout. The match concluded 2-2 after normal time. Cristiano Ronaldo scored his 100th goal for Al-Nassr during the game from the penalty spot. However, his team missed crucial penalties as Al-Ahli Saudi secured the victory. Ronaldo's quest for a major trophy with Al-Nassr continues.

title: US Open 2025: Jannik Sinner, Carlos Alcaraz show reigns, but who's next?
content: The US Open anticipates a potential shift in men's tennis as the Sinner-Alcaraz duopoly faces challenges. Djokovic highlights the possibility of a 'third guy' disrupting their dominance, drawing parallels to his early career. Ben Shelton, with his unique style and recent success, emerges as a contender, aiming to challenge the top players and make a significant impact at the tournament.

title: Neurologist warns of 5 signs that increases the risk of dementia
content: Dr. Bing highlights subtle, often overlooked signs that may indicate early brain changes linked to dementia. These include balance issues, difficulty rising from a chair, acting out dreams, persistent loneliness, and weak hand grip. Recognizing these early warning signs can be crucial for protecting long-term cognitive health and enabling timely interventions.

title: 'My throat is sore': Rijiju slams oppn over 'ruckus'; accuses MPs of 'running away'
content: Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju lamented a sore throat from imploring the opposition to allow smooth Parliament proceedings during the Monsoon session. He criticized opposition MPs for allegedly avoiding government questioning.

title: 'He predicted what happened next': Amitabh Bachchan recalls Sachin's brilliance
content: Amitabh Bachchan praised Sachin Tendulkar's exceptional cricketing intellect, recalling instances where Tendulkar accurately predicted game scenarios. Bachchan highlighted Tendulkar's profound knowledge and ability to foresee movements in the game and bowling strategies. Recently, the Tendulkar family celebrated Arjun Tendulkar's engagement and Sara Tendulkar's launch of her Pilates studio, marking significant personal milestones.

title: 'I don’t think he will play ...': Ex-SA star praises selectors for managing Bumrah
content: South African legend AB de Villiers predicted India pacer Jasprit Bumrah won't play every Asia Cup 2025 game due to workload management, despite his inclusion in the squad. De Villiers supported selectors' proactive approach to protect senior players like Bumrah, emphasising the importance of managing workload to get the best performance.

title: Elon Musk on SpaceX success: Watched rocket failures; turned setbacks into milestones
content: Elon Musk reflects on SpaceX's improbable journey, recalling initial skepticism and a friend's reminder of potential failures. Despite facing daunting odds and a low survival chance, Musk's persistence fueled the company's relentless innovation. From early setbacks to groundbreaking achievements like reusable rockets, SpaceX now spearheads global space ambitions, aiming to land humans on Mars within five years.

title: Brittany Mahomes steals spotlight: Styles Patrick for Chiefs game; QB shines in preseason finale
content: Patrick Mahomes showcased his skills in the Kansas City Chiefs' final preseason game, throwing for 143 yards and a touchdown. Meanwhile, his wife, Brittany Mahomes, made a style statement by choosing his game-day outfit, sharing a photo on Instagram. Despite Mahomes' strong performance and an improved offensive line, the Chiefs lost to the Chicago Bears 29-27.

title: Germany welcomes more students from India: New geography of Indian ambition
content: Amid rising visa hurdles, costs, and political tensions in the US, Germany is emerging as the top destination for Indian students. With nearly 60,000 Indian students now enrolled—a 20% annual rise—Germany offers affordable education, English-taught programmes, and streamlined post-study work routes. Meanwhile, the US faces a sharp decline in Indian student arrivals, exacerbated by slow visa processing and policy uncertainty. Indian families are increasingly choosing Germany for its predictability, affordability, and career-aligned academic structure.

title: ‘Track stray dogs with GPS, QR codes’: Shimla launches new drive after SC order
content: The Shimla Municipal Corporation has launched a comprehensive stray dog monitoring program using GPS collars and QR codes, aiming to enhance public safety and reduce rabies cases. This initiative follows a Supreme Court directive on stray dog management, emphasizing sterilization and vaccination.

title: ED busts Rs 130 crore illegal call centre scam; seizes 8 luxury cars
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has uncovered a massive scam orchestrated by young individuals operating illegal call centers, defrauding US citizens of over $15 million. Arjun Gulati, Divyansh Goel, and Abhinav Kalra are identified as key individuals running the scam.

title: India suspends US-bound postal services; effective Aug 25 - what’s exempted
content: Effective August 25, 2025, the Department of Posts will temporarily suspend most international postal services to the US due to new customs regulations. The US Executive Order No. 14324 withdraws duty-free exemptions for goods valued up to $800, imposing duties on all goods except gift items under $100. The executive order also outlines new responsibilities for transport carriers and “qualified parties” authorized by US Customs and Border Protection (CBP).

title: Watch: Giant Trump effigy paraded at Nagpur festival; protesters oppose tariffs on India
content: During the annual Marbat Utsav in Nagpur, a giant effigy of Donald Trump was paraded to protest the US government's recent tariffs on Indian goods. The festival, rooted in 19th-century traditions of warding off evil, has evolved into a platform for social and political commentary.

title: 'He's a genius!': Bizarre Dhoni stumping leaves AUS wicketkeeper in disbelief
content: During a 2016 T20I between India and Australia, MS Dhoni executed a remarkable stumping of James Faulkner, sparking debate about whether it was intentional or accidental. Faulkner's attempted cut shot deflected off Dhoni's pad onto the stumps, leaving the batter stranded. Alex Carey suggested Dhoni's genius made the improbable seem deliberate, highlighting the respect he commands for his instinctive skills.

title: Easyjet flight scare: Delirious passenger attempts cockpit break-in; jet diverted back to Lyon
content: An Easyjet flight en route from Lyon to Porto made an emergency return after a 26-year-old Portuguese passenger, experiencing delirium, attempted to force his way into the cockpit shortly after takeoff. Fellow passengers restrained the individual until the plane landed back in Lyon, where police took him into custody.

title: Doctor reveals ideal time to take supplements for maximum absorption
content: Amidst rising supplement usage, with 75% of Americans relying on them for health, a neuroscientist, Robert W.B. Love, advises on optimal timing for absorption. He suggests taking minerals like selenium, magnesium, and zinc on an empty stomach to enhance bioavailability. Love recommends pairing other supplements with fats like coconut oil, while avoiding high-fiber combinations that could hinder absorption. Read below!

title: 'It's weird': AB de Villiers baffled by Shreyas Iyer’s Asia Cup snub
content: AB de Villiers expressed surprise at Shreyas Iyer's exclusion from India's Asia Cup squad, despite Iyer's strong IPL performance, Champions Trophy contribution, and leadership qualities. De Villiers speculated that non-cricketing factors, such as team dynamics or an abundance of leaders, might have influenced the selectors' decision, urging further inquiry into the matter.

title: Taylor Swift & Travis Kelce: Iconic Super Bowl photo immortalized; Chiefs Hall of Honor nod
content: Taylor Swift's monumental impact on the Kansas City Chiefs during their Super Bowl-winning 2024 season has earned her a spot in the team's Hall of Honor. Her relationship with Travis Kelce brought unprecedented attention and viewership to the team and the NFL. Swift's presence transcended sports, blending music, pop culture, and football in a way that redefined the Chiefs' season.

title: 'Expelled for praising Yogi': SP rebel Pooja Pal; claims removal boosted Atiq Ahmed's supporters
content: Pooja Pal, expelled from Samajwadi Party, alleges her removal boosted Atiq Ahmed's supporters after she praised CM Yogi and criticized the gangster. In a letter to Akhilesh Yadav, she expressed fears for her life, accusing the party of endangering her and warned that SP would be responsible if she were murdered like her husband.

title: Watch: Massive fire erupts at Louisiana auto supply plant; residents ordered to evacuate
content: A major explosion and fire erupted at Smitty’s Supply in Louisiana, a lubricant and automotive fluid manufacturer, prompting immediate evacuations within a one-mile radius, including an elementary school. Multiple agencies, including the EPA and LDEQ, are responding to the incident, monitoring air quality, and providing support.

title: White House backs DUI deportation bill: Green card and visa holders at risk; immigrants on edge
content: A proposed law in the US may change immigration rules. It could lead to deportation for green card holders with past DUI offenses. Even a single DUI conviction could create problems. This affects visa applications and reentry after foreign travel. Immigration lawyers advise green card holders to apply for citizenship now.

title: Cong MLA arrested after massive hoard of cash recovered; gold worth Rs 6 cr seized
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) apprehended Karnataka Congress MLA KC Veerendra in Gangtok for allegedly leasing land for a casino. This arrest followed raids on 30 of his properties, uncovering Rs 12 crore in cash, including foreign currency, gold jewellery valued at Rs 6 crore, and 10 kgs of silver. The ED also froze 17 bank accounts and seized property documents.

title: J&K: Hizb sleeper cell busted; OGW arrested, linked to cross-border terror handler
content: Jammu and Kashmir Police's SIA made a significant breakthrough by apprehending Altaf Hussain Wagay, an over-ground worker linked to Hizbul Mujahideen. Wagay, a resident of Shopian, was operating as a sleeper cell, facilitating terror activities in the region. Investigations revealed his direct links with a Hizb handler operating from across the border, orchestrating anti-national activities.

title: Top 5 entertainment news: Govinda’s team admits Sunita Ahuja filed for divorce & more
content: The entertainment world is buzzing with news, as Govinda's team addresses past divorce filings while the actor makes a public appearance amid current rumors. An AI tool mimicking Sushant Singh Rajput sparks controversy, drawing criticism from his family. Meanwhile, Zayed Khan commends Hrithik and Sussanne's post-divorce relationship, and Mouni Roy gracefully shuts down a critical comment about her appearance.

title: Ex-cricketer's wife dies at supermarket - 'We were to retire together'
content: Wiyada Pauline, 46, wife of former Surrey cricketer Duncan Pauline, unexpectedly passed away at a Waitrose supermarket in Esher. Emergency services responded to a medical emergency call but were unable to revive her. Duncan Pauline, 64, expressed his devastation, revealing they had planned to retire together in the near future. Police confirmed no suspicious circumstances surrounded her death.

title: Married man dies after hotel sex with lover in China; woman fined Rs 7.5 lakh
content: A Chinese court has ordered a woman, Zhuang, to compensate the family of her deceased married lover, Zhou, with 62,000 Yuan. Zhou died of a heart attack after a hotel encounter. The court found Zhuang secondarily responsible for not seeking immediate help and for violating public order by having an affair, while the hotel was absolved of any fault.

title: Johnson slams Bears' offense: 'Not good enough'
content: Bears coach Ben Johnson called out a "sloppy" first half in Friday's preseason win over the Chiefs that included a fumble and critical penalties, saying, "We got to get better in a hurry."

title: Wrexham, Mac back bid to save league opponents
content: Wrexham co-owner Rob Mac has supported a U-turn by the club to allow Sheffield Wednesday fans to bring a banner to Saturday's game calling for their owner Dejphon Chansiri to sell the club.

title: Zilisch lands Cup ride with Trackhouse Racing
content: Connor Zilisch, a 19-year-old driver who has seven victories in NASCAR's second-tier Xfinity Series this season, is getting promoted to a Cup ride in 2026.

title: Reyna leaves Dortmund for fresh start at Gladbach
content: United States midfielder Gio Reyna has completed his transfer to Borussia Mönchengladbach from Bundesliga rivals Borussia Dortmund.

title: Ronaldo 1st player with 100 goals for four clubs
content: Cristiano Ronaldo became the first player to score 100 competitive goals for four different clubs on Saturday.

title: Steelers' Harmon thought knee injury was serious
content: Steelers first-round pick Derrick Harmon said Saturday he initially feared the MCL sprain that took him out of the preseason finale was "serious."

title: Venus returning to US Open at age 45 'inspiring'
content: Venus Williams will be the first 45-year-old to compete at the US Open since 1981 when she faces Karolina Muchova on Monday.

title: Rays' Williams has HR, 3 RBIs in 'amazing' debut
content: Carson Williams homered and went 2-for-4 with three RBIs in his major league debut, a day after the Tampa Bay Rays called up the former first-round pick.

title: 🏈 Adam Schefter's fantasy football cheat sheet
content: No one is more plugged in to the latest buzz around the NFL than Adam Schefter. We asked him to share his favorite values in fantasy drafts with you.

title: Marching bands! Big entrances! Sing-alongs! 36 of our favorite game-day traditions
content: With a new season here, we look at some of the wild, wacky, wonderful reasons we love college football.

title: NFL preseason takeaways and 53-man roster projections: Ravens CB Keyon Martin makes a statement
content: The final games of the 2025 preseason help flesh out key battles ahead of Tuesday's 53-man roster cuts.

title: Who needs Eze? Spurs' win at Man City shows transfers aren't everything
content: Losing out to Arsenal for Eberechi Eze was humbling for Spurs. But maybe they've already made their signing of the summer by hiring Thomas Frank.

title: Preseason report cards for every single rookie selected in the 2025 NFL draft
content: How did Hunter look in training camp? What's next for Shough? We checked in on all 32 teams' rookie classes.

title: Walker tops Zhang at UFC Fight Night in Shanghai
content: Johnny Walker ended a skid of two straight knockout losses by scoring a shocking knockout of his own.

title: Projecting the NFL's sack leaders for 2025: Which pass rushers will get after the QB this season?
content: Will Aidan Hutchinson, Micah Parsons or Trey Hendrickson lead the NFL in sacks? Seth Walder projects this season's top sack-getters.

title: Red Sox in must-win mode? Are Yankees back? What you should -- and shouldn't -- believe in the American League
content: How big is this series with New York for Boston? Is Toronto the best team in the AL? We give verdicts on what it all means.

title: How a swing tweak took Roman Anthony to the next level
content: The Red Sox rookie made his Yankee Stadium debut with a bang, but lately, he has been pummeling everybody.

title: 📉 Barnwell picks five NFL teams set to decline
content: Which teams will take a step back and lose more games this season? We made five picks based on troubling signs, offseason subtractions and more.

title: 💰 Jones: Offer to Parsons was richest for non-QB
content: Jerry Jones said the agreement he believed he made with Micah Parsons would have been the richest ever for a non-quarterback, adding, "Nobody has ever offered him more money than I have to play football. Period."

title: ⛳ Rory: Took home 1,100 Masters flags after win
content: Rory McIlroy said he took all 1,100 pin flags from the Masters Shop after winning at Augusta National in April. "I've waited 17 years to sign that flag in the middle, and I will never complain about doing it."

title: 'We are what we drive': How car dealers became college football's power brokers
content: More college football players are driving sports cars than ever before. But the connection between dealers and programs goes back decades.

title: Inside Arch Manning's wild recruitment saga
content: Getting the heir to football's QB dynasty to commit was destined to be crazy. But this was even beyond that.

title: High school coach? Ayesha Curry opens up on spouse Stephen Curry's early career goal
content: Ayesha Curry, who is married to two-time NBA MVP Stephen Curry, revealed he wanted to be a high school basketball coach.

title: Russell Westbrook makes music video cameo with Ciara
content: The NBA free agent made a surprise cameo, showing off his moves alongside the Grammy Award-winning singer.

title: LeBron, KD and an unprecedented next chapter in their 20-year rivalry
content: For two decades, the two superstars have led superteams to NBA glory. Now, for the first time, they're both looking up at one -- and perhaps the best one yet.

title: PLL quarterfinals preview: Key stats, matchups, how to watch
content: Which teams will advance to take on the Atlas and Outlaws in the next round? Here's what you need to know.

title: The best worst transfers: Why the likes of Sancho, Werner were actually smart signings
content: Sometimes, a transfer should work out, but doesn't. Here are the best worst transfers over the past decade in the Premier League and beyond.

title: Reid's annual HBCU watch list: Ranking the top 10 prospects for the 2026 NFL draft
content: Ahead of Saturday's Cricket MEAC/SWAC Challenge Kickoff, we ranked 10 HBCU players who could be on next year's NFL draft radar.

title: The Story Of A Bengal Butcher Who 'Saved' Calcutta
content: Rather than being stoic over the aggressive agenda of the Muslim League to bring Calcutta into Pakistan, a fierce man from a city-based meat-selling Brahmin family rose to the occasion.

title: Indian-Origin Man Seeks Apology After 47-Day-Jail In False US Kidnapping Case
content: An Indian-origin man has demanded a public apology from law enforcement in Georgia after spending 47 days in jail on what turned out to be false kidnapping charges.

title: Indian-Origin Woman Quits Business To Feed Homeless In Washington Amid Trump Crackdown
content: A former IT staffing entrepreneur, Nupur Panjabi walked away from a thriving business to build something very different, a community kitchen that now feeds thousands of homeless people across Virginia."I'm not even a millionaire," she says.

title: "Act Of Predator": Delhi Court Convicts Man For Rape, Murder Of Minor In 2014
content: A court in Delhi on Saturday convicted a man for kidnapping, raping and killing a two-year-old girl in 2014, saying the prosecution had established the charges against him.

title: 2 Months After Crime, Charge Sheet Filed In Kolkata Law College Rape Case
content: A charge sheet was filed on Saturday against four accused in the alleged gang rape of a law student on her college campus in Kolkata, around two months after the crime, police said.

title: Pressure Builds, Kerala Congress MLA Accused Of Misconduct Refuses To Resign
content: Having stepped down as the Kerala Youth Congress president following allegations of misconduct against women, Palakkad MLA Rahul Mamkootathil is now facing growing calls for resigning from the state Assembly as well.

title: "Selectively Singled Out": Team Anil Ambani On CBI Raids In Loan Fraud Case
content: The search by CBI at residence of industralist Anil D Ambani's residence concluded early this afternoon, a spokesperson on behalf of industralist said on Saturday.

title: Berlin Renames Controversial 'Moors Street' After Years Of Debate
content: A Berlin street was officially renamed on Saturday for an 18th-century African philosopher after years of debate over its previous name that many considered outdated and offensive.

title: "Don't Want To Speak Bad Of...": Maxwell Floats Epstein-Princess Diana Date Setup
content: Ghislaine Maxwell, the convicted associate of sex offender Jeffrey Epstein has suggested that he may have been arranged for a date with the late Princess Diana, according to tapes released by the Department of Justice on Friday.

title: Boy, 14, Detained For 10-Year-Old Girl's Murder In Hyderabad: Cops
content: A 14-year-old boy murdered a 10-year-old girl when the latter caught him trying to steal a cricket bat, police said.

title: Trump Was Once A Republican Party Outsider. How Tables Have Turned
content: Amy Kremer was an early tea party leader who supported Donald Trump for president in 2016. She ran for Congress from Georgia in 2017 and got less than 1% of the Republican primary vote.

title: NDTV Exclusive: Mystery Deaths In Satpura Tiger Reserve, Letter Points To Lapses
content: Barely two months after security guard Hariram was found dead under unexplained circumstances in the Barchpada beat of Satpura Tiger Reserve, the mutilated body of a tiger has now been recovered from the very same stretch of the Tawa River in Narmada

title: Former Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe Moved To ICU A Day After Being Jailed
content: Sri Lanka's jailed former president was rushed to intensive care at a state hospital on Saturday, a day after being charged with misusing government funds for foreign travel.

title: Syria Delays Lawmaker Selection In Druze And Kurdish-Controlled Areas
content: A Syrian official said Saturday that the selection process planned for a transitional parliament next month will be postponed in Druze-majority Sweida and two Kurdish-held provinces.

title: Man Arrested For Posing As Karnataka Minister's Assistant, Cheating People
content: A man who had been impersonating the personal assistant of Karnataka Education Minister Madhu Bangarappa was arrested on Friday, police said.

title: 'World Calling Me A Killer': Man's Post Before His Arrest For Wife's Murder
content: Seen in a video assaulting his wife and arrested for setting her ablaze, a man from Greater Noida has implied that she died by suicide, going on to say that the world is calling him a killer because "she left him".

title: Woman Killed For Dowry In Greater Noida, Video Shows Her Aflame, Hobbling Down Stairs
content: Horrifying footage has emerged of a woman being beaten up by her husband and in-laws in Greater Noida and then walking down the stairs while on fire. The woman's sister has said both of them were being tortured for dowry

title: How Chandrababu Naidu Turned Rs 7,000 Into A Rs 6,755-Crore Dairy Empire
content: The latest report by the Association for Democratic Reforms (ADR), which pegs the collective assets of India's Chief Ministers at over Rs 1,600 crore, places Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu at the very top.

title: J&K Authorities Issue Advisories Amid Intense Rainfall Forecast
content: Authorities on Saturday issued advisories amid a weather forecast of intense rainfall with possibility of cloudbursts, flash floods and landslides in high altitude areas of Jammu and Kashmir during the next four days.

title: Syrian Man Arrested In Gujarat For Misusing Funds Raised For Gaza: Cops
content: A Syrian national who was raising funds from mosques here purportedly for the needy residents of war-torn Gaza has been arrested while his three compatriots are absconding, the city police said on Saturday.
